item.description: Assignments for NEW271 are linked here as I put them up on the site. See the Syllabus for an overview of assignments and their values.

item.title: Encountering the Madawaska
item.description: Note Sept 4, 2018: some changes are likely due to fluctuating class size. Please consider this version a rough guideline only. Due Date: Paper 10/10; Participation before, during, and after trip This assignment involves participation in and reflection on an excursion to the Madawaska River, where we will learn about the history and geography of the region while camping on the river bank and taking white water skills instruction. Final dates of the trip have been set for Sept 29 and 30.

item.title: Encountering the Madawaska: Personal Risk Mitigation Plan
item.description: This Pass/Fail assignment is worth 10% of your final grade, and is due 09/26. Before completing this assignment, carefully read the Trip Description, as well as Chapter 3 of Beames & Brown, Adventurous Learning, esp. pp. 24-25, 30-33. Risk Assessment “Risk” is not only a concept of recent origin (cf. Beames & Brown 2016), but a feature of many parts of our experience: physical, social, emotional, etc. In a brief statement or essay of no more than 300 words, describe the various risks involved in a trip such as “Encountering the Madawaska,” foregrounding those you think are most serious.

item.title: Participation
item.description: Your participation mark is substantial (20%) and reflects the unusual nature of the seminar. The mark has two components: Each week at the start of class, you will hand in a piece of paper with a short quote from the readings and an accompanying question about the text. The question may (or may not) be used to as a discussion prompt for the class. During course discussions, you will be expected to participate actively.
